function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Dominance of million-dollar cities in areas with attractive natural surroundings","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increase in remote work leading to reduced physical interaction and potential decrease in building occupancy","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Conversion of office spaces to residential units leading to increased population density in downtown areas","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Shifting transportation and land-use patterns leading to changes in urban infrastructure and public spaces","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spread of covid-19 facilitated by connectivity","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Economic impact of high unemployment and social distancing","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Environmental impacts from changed behaviors and economic recovery","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Higher density associated with higher rates of mortality from and transmission of highly contagious diseases, including covid-19.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of in-depth research on measuring connectivity in cities and its impact on the spread of pandemics.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Low number of studies examining the impact of density on highly contagious new infections.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Financial anxiety leading to homeowners avoiding selling their homes due to uncertainties caused by covid-19","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased teleworking leading to potential homebuyers considering a new home if telework arrangements continue post-pandemic","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Expectation of higher sale price leading to delay in selling homes","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased demand for new construction homes leading to more densely populated areas","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Relocation from dense cities to suburbs","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased home fitness and wellness areas may lead to the spread of contagious diseases if not properly maintained and sanitized.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Rapid increase in pet ownership and demand for pet-friendly rentals can lead to the spread of zoonotic diseases.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of social distancing and sanitation in shared pet-friendly spaces may contribute to the transmission of diseases among pet owners and their animals.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased emphasis on outdoor space may lead to overcrowding in outdoor public spaces, increasing the risk of contagious disease transmission.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Rapid adoption of smart-home technology may lead to a false sense of security, neglecting traditional cleaning and disinfection practices.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased demand for touchless and smart home products may lead to privacy and data security risks.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased demand for home amenities like pools, waterfronts, and docks may lead to overcrowding and increased contact, contributing to the spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Rising trend of intergenerational living may increase the risk of disease transmission within households due to close proximity and shared living spaces.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Growing interest in gourmet kitchens may result in greater use of communal cooking and dining spaces, leading to potential contamination and the spread of foodborne illnesses.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lockdowns and social distancing impacting construction companies","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential bankruptcy for engineering and construction companies","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increase in demand for homes with dedicated office spaces due to remote work","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Supply chain disruptions and workflow issues in the construction industry due to covid-19","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Health and safety risks in indoor spaces due to covid-19","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Legal implications and contract revisions due to covid-19","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of personal space and outdoor spaces in current housing stock","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased remote working leading to prolonged indoor exposure","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Monetization of housing leading to overcrowding and substandard living conditions","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Shared areas in condo buildings seen as risky inconvenience due to covid-19","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited or zero access to common areas and non-essential amenities in residential buildings","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Shift in housing interior trends towards healthier and touch-free technologies","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Blurring lines between work and home life could lead to increased transmission of contagious diseases within households.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Technology-facilitated real-time residential management could lead to increased exposure to contagious diseases if not implemented with appropriate health and safety protocols.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Shift in homebuyer preferences and housing locations due to covid-19 could lead to spread of contagious diseases in new residential areas.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential for increased density in urban areas due to the need for affordable housing. this could lead to higher risk of contagious disease transmission.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Conversion of office spaces in city centers to residential units could lead to changes in population density and potential disease exposure.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Shortages of affordable housing for low-income people and families","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Decrease in road traffic flows and major cities experiencing drops in rush-hour traffic congestion","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased investment in energy efficiency and retrofitting of buildings","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Spread of infection in cities due to close contact in vulnerable households, construction sites, and local businesses.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on digital platforms for cultural resources, municipal services, and participation may lead to increased virtual interactions and dependence.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential long-term coexistence with covid-19 leading to ongoing public health concerns and the need for sustainable recovery strategies.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Vulnerable groups such as the elderly, women, the poor, and migrants disproportionately affected by pandemic","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Shift towards digital life and remote work","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Changing trust in local authorities","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"}]}
